acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.0006mg/L(Silver (I) Nitrate Equivalent: 0.0013mg/L) of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,173mg/kg(CERI Hazard Data 2001-57 (2002)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that current toxicity data are insufficient for classification and no existing classification is available.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1, there was bio-accumulation (BCF=600 (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and it was a metallic compound and the underwater action was unknown, it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale:
No data available though being nitrates, containing chemical groups with explosive properties.
Classified into Division 5.1 (UN#1493) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Based on the classification by UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods: Division 5.1, oxidizing substances (no subsidiary risks), Packing group II (UN#1493).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of damage to the testes including seminiferous tubule necrosis, described in IUCLID(2000).

self_reactive_substances.rationale:
No data available, though being nitrates, containing chemical groups with explosive properties.
Classified into "Division 5.1: oxidizing substances" (UN#1493) by UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "moderate to severe irritation" in rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-57 (2002)), suggesting the substance is "severely irritating" to the eyes, and the evidence of skin corrosivity.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the testing data of guinea pig skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-57 (2002)):"Corrosive." Although classified into 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety, if further subclassification is needed.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (lung, kidney, cardiovascular system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including  "lung and kidney damage and atherosclerosis" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-57 (2002)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (blood system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "acute airway irritation" (PATTY (4th, 2000)), and the evidence from animal studies including "methemoglobinemia" (ICSC (J) (1998)), "cyanosis, diarrhea, increased locomotor activity and spasm"(CERI Hazard data 2001-57 (2002)). The effects on the central nervous system are considered as secondary, resulting from the effects on the blood system. The effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
